questions.title: GH repository documented in Labs
questions.description: Use N/A when GH repository not required.

questions.title: Description in GH present & meaningful
questions.description: Skip only when GH repository not required.

questions.title: Setup instructions in the README
questions.description: Both development setup and deployment considerations.

questions.title: Standard config store or description of a non-standard config in the README
questions.description: For example: database.yml & secrets.yml is standard for Rails 4

questions.title: No sensitive information exposed in the repository
questions.description: For example: secret token, mailer details, CartoDB access, Amazon keys, user data

questions.title: No hardcoded urls, emails or other pieces of configuration in code
questions.description: For example: third-party API urls, notification emails

questions.title: Relevant passwords shared through the Admin Password DB
questions.description: For example: access details to any third party APIs

questions.title: Team members documented in Labs
questions.description: Current lead and developers required.

questions.title: Obsolete documentation removed
questions.description: Especially outdated setup instructions.

questions.title: Ruby version documented in Labs
questions.description: Use N/A when Ruby not relevant

questions.title: Rails version documented in Labs
questions.description: Use N/A when Rails not relevant

questions.title: Gemfile.lock with versions locked for futureproofing
questions.description: For example: gems that depend on system or external APIs

questions.title: Gemfile cleaned from unused gems & upgraded to reasonable versions
questions.description: For example: no gems with security flaws, no serious issues reported by Snyk

questions.title: System dependencies documented in Labs
questions.description: For example: redis, MaxMind, LaTeX

questions.title: Background jobs configured
questions.description: For example: redis installed, redis db assigned. Skippable where not applicable or for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Background jobs documented in Labs
questions.description: For example: redis connection string if sidekiq / redis workers are used on shared hosts. Skippable where not applicable.

questions.title: Cron jobs configured
questions.description: For Rails applications as part of deploy script, e.g. via whenever gem. Skippable where not applicable or for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Cron jobs documented in Labs
questions.description: For example: scheduled runs of aggregation scripts, geo location batch processing. Skippable where not applicable.

questions.title: Email service configured
questions.description: Make sure site actually sends out emails (if applicable), a test end-point is useful. Skippable where not applicable.

questions.title: Automated multi-stage deployment scripts
questions.description: For example: Capistrano for Rails applications. Skippable for legacy applications or applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Production instance documented in Labs
questions.description: Any temporary or experimental instances should be documented as well, no zombie sites. Skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Staging instance documented in Labs
questions.description: Any temporary or experimental instances should be documented as well, no zombie sites.

questions.title: Backups configured
questions.description: Both database & file system (where applicable). Only skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Backups documented in Labs
questions.description: Backup locations. Only skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Availability monitoring configured for all subsystems
questions.description: For example: nagios checks for web application & sidekiq workers
Only skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Performance monitoring configured
questions.description: For example: New Relic, munin

questions.title: Assets load correctly
questions.description: For example: font awesome, sprites included by js libraries

questions.title: Logs are written to & rotated
questions.description: For example: standard rails logs, sidekiq log, cron output log. Only skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Temporary installations & zombie sites cleaned up
questions.description: Also temporary databases, especially if they contain user data. Only skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Automated test suite passes
questions.description: Only skippable for legacy applications.

questions.title: CI build configured
questions.description: Only skippable for legacy applications.

questions.title: Test coverage > 80%
questions.description: For example: simplecov, CodeClimate

questions.title: Exception notification configured
questions.description: Email / slack notifications configured or other error tracking service in place. Only skippable for legacy applications or applications hosted elsewhere

questions.title: Application code security audit passed
questions.description: For example: http://brakemanscanner.org/, security report in CodeClimate or review by human

questions.title: Application code style review passed
questions.description: For example: https://github.com/railsbp/rails_best_practices, https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop or review by human

questions.title: Site renders properly in IE
questions.description: Most of the time versions 9+ need to be considered.

questions.title: Site renders properly on mobile devices
questions.description: For example: the Google Page Speed Insights check

questions.title: Google Analytics configured
questions.description: Skippable for applications hosted elsewhere.

questions.title: Title & meta tags set properly
questions.description: Skippable for internal tools.
